The Mille Fire is the fairest popular car with the consumer's pocket. In addition to being much cheaper than Celta, it has a similar performance (despite having 15CV less), extremely low consumption (mine does 14Km / l in SP traffic and 18Km / l on the road), excellent stability (even with the 145 / 80-13 tires), good internal space, very low noise level (even above 120Km / h) and very low maintenance cost (this is very rare). We have at home a Celta Flex 2006 that , in fact, has a more attractive design, but Mille does not disappoint, even having a much older design. I travel monthly from SP to SC (about 700Km) and I do not find it uncomfortable. I am extremely satisfied with the car, since I have had bigger models like Astra, Santana, Marea, Siena, etc. That's why I say it's the Brazilian reality car , because it is easy to maintain and has extremely low fuel consumption, without compromising performance.
